snippet: The man thought to have masterminded the kidnapping at the Algerian natural gas field has a long history in smuggling, jihad and politics in the region.
abstract: Mokhtar Belmokhtar, man thought to have masterminded kidnapping at Algerian natural-gas field, has long history in smuggling, jihad and politics in region; raid is thought to be retaliation for French military action in Mali.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and ADAM NOSSITER
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Paris, and Adam Nossiter from Bamako, Mali. Harvey Morris contributed reporting from London, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The man thought to have masterminded the kidnapping at the Algerian natural gas field has a long history in smuggling, jihad and politics in the region.

headline.seo: Mokhtar Belmokhtar Thought to Be Kidnapping’s Mastermind
headline.main: Jihad ‘Prince,’ a Kidnapper, Is Tied to Raid
headline.print_headline: Jihad ‘Prince,’ A Kidnapper, Is Tied to Raid

keywords.value: Mujao (Movement for Oneness and Jihad in West Africa)
